sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Lives of the Hermits Paul and Guthlac
Vita Pauli. Vita Guthlaci
msDesc.p: Vellum, 230 140 9 x 5.6, ff. 66, 19 lines to a page. Cent. ix?, in an exquisite flat-topped minuscule of Celtic aspect.

From St Augustine's, Canterbury: on f. 1r at top: Di. IXa Gradu tercio V. Lower down (xii):
Vita S. pauli primi heremite.
Vita S. Guthlaci.
(xiv) Liber S. Aug. Cant.
Not entered in the old catalogue.

msItem.head: Jerome, Vita Sancti Pauli primi heremitae

ab.decoNote: On f. 1v is a full-page drawing of Jerome, tonsured, beardless, in green robe, face R. seated in a rich chair writing in book on desk, with pen in R. and knife in L. hand. A dove at his ear. Architecture above, supported by shafts with acanthus capitals. A curtain, twisted up, hangs on R.

msItem.ab: Preface. Title in red and green capitals. Very fine initial in black and red outline: interlaced work in black: dragons' heads in red
msItem.incipit: Hieronimus presbiter natus a patre eusebio hunc librum scripsit in bethleem in loco uidelicet militum qui uocatur litostrotos: temnanus ait. si quidem aptum erat ut de milite in loco militum scriberetur uel in oppido stridodis quod nomen uersum a gothis dalmatia nuncupatur, etc.
msItem.explicit: quia ambo in uita eorum adfirmauerunt uerbum eorum post mortem alterius alter dicit
msItem.rubric: De variis estimationibus quis utique primus monachus habitauit heremum
msItem.incipit: Inter multos saepe dubitatum est a quo potissimum

ab.decoNote: Titles of chapters in red rustic capitals. Initials usually plain purple, but sometimes in outline, interlaced

msItem.explicit: tonicam pauli cum meritis eius quam regum purpuras cum poenis suis

msItem.head: Felix of Crowland, Vita Sancti Guthlaci
msItem.ab: on f. 17v is a faint pencil sketch in excellent style of a king throned full-face, a sword across his knee, holding up an admonitory finger to a beardless person on R.
msItem.incipit: In domino dominorum domino meo mihi pre ceteris regalium primatuum gradibus dilectissimo aelfuualdo
msItem.explicit: principium in principio finem in fine conpono
msItem.rubric: Incipit capitula libri Sancti Guthlaci anachorite
msItem.ab: Initials alternately green and purple: 53 capp. ending 22r
msItem.rubric: In nomine trino et divino Incipit liber de vita Sancti Guthlaci strenuissimi ac perfectissimi anachoritae
msItem.incipit: Fuit itaque in diebus aethelredi inlustris anglorum regis

ab.decoNote: The first two words of the incipit in green and purple capitals
Magnificent initial of interlaced work and dragons' heads as on f. 2r

msItem.ab: On f. 34v strofosus is glossed frÊte
On f. 35v raucisonis is glossed hasgrumelum and horrescere hly˛an
On f. 41r strinebant (-debant) is glossed scriccettan
On and after f. 57v viii lections are marked in the margin, from: Contigit ergo inter haec postquam dilectus dei famulus gu˛lacus ter quinis annorum uoluminibus
msItem.explicit: Uiditque uidentes quos prius uidere negauit. Grates deo persoluens dignas quas nullus reddere nescit
msItem.ab: Cf. MS 307. Acta Sanctorum II Aprilis, etc.
On f. 66v beginning of an alphabet in green capitals and a late scribble

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by SP, BA, CF
